meanings.definition: A tuft of fine filaments by which certain bivalve mollusks attach themselves to rocks or other objects.
meanings.sent1: The byssi of the clam help it stick to the rock.
meanings.sent2: I found some byssi on the shell of the mussel.
meanings.sent3: The byssi of the oyster were so strong, they could lift small pebbles.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the byssi of a mussel, firmly holding onto her goals.
meanings.sent5: The byssi of the scallop were delicate yet powerful, like tiny anchors in the sea.

meanings.definition: A fine, hairlike filament produced by certain fungi.
meanings.sent1: The byssi of the mushroom were very thin and delicate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the byssi of the mold under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The byssi of the fungus seemed to dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as fine as the byssi of a mold, flowing gently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The byssi of the yeast formed a beautiful pattern under the microscope.
